projects.title: Math(s) keyboard
projects.description: For simpleclub, I helped to create and come up with a fully fledged math keyboard package that allows editing any math expressions. The UI is typeset using TeX and the expressions can be evaluated in converted formats. All of it is fully integrated into Flutter, from physical keyboard input to framework-esque styling and focus tree support ðŸš€

projects.title: URL strategy
projects.description: For simpleclub, I created a convenience plugin for Flutter web apps that easily allows everyone to use the path URL strategy.

projects.title: Fireworks
projects.description: 2D canvas-based fireworks animations in Flutter. Made available as a web app, with customization options. Additionally, built it as a system that allowed incredibly easy integration into e.g. the Flutter starter app, the counter app :)

projects.title: Funvas
projects.description: Time-based canvas animations in Flutter. Inspired by Dwitter, using some simple trigonometric functions and a time-based draw function, I was able to create some nice animations âœ¨ In order to simplify the process, I created the funvas package.

projects.title: CaTeX
projects.description: Created a Dart-native Flutter TeX renderer for simpleclub. This includes a TeX parser and a widget + rendering setup that I came up with on my own (: The implementation is quite low-level (as far as sensible Flutter implementations go), which also makes it extremely fast. It terms of performance and flexibility, it is superior to any other TeX plugin for Flutter that came before that.

links.hint: Flutter web demo application for CaTeX

projects.title: Flutter Clock
projects.description: Created a custom clock face for the Flutter Clock challenge. It was selected as the winner for Code Quality out of over 850 unique submissions ðŸš€ In this project, I made use of custom render objects to achieve full layout control - I also wrote an article about that. Moreover, everything was done in code, i.e. all animations and all design elements. I was able to achieve quite good skeuomorphism with the help of some custom fonts (:

links.hint: Clock face running on Flutter web
Article about the creation process on Medium
Contest Results as an article on Medium

projects.title: Wakelock plugin
projects.description: A simple solution to keep the device screen awake in a Flutter app. The plugin is based on another plugin that was no longer maintained. So, I decided to create my own maintained version.

projects.title: Aso
projects.description: Developed a Firebase driven Flutter app with a custom animation editor written in C++ (using dart:ffi) for Incom. The backend is written in JavaScript. Additionally, I created designs and even promotional videos.

projects.title: Feature discovery package
projects.description: A Flutter package that implements tap target feature discovery from a Material design spec. I am not the original author but majorly contributed later. This is Flutter-only, i.e. it has no native implementations, only design. However, it is more complex than the wakelock plugin.

projects.title: StackOverflow answers
projects.description: I have been active on StackOverflow for quite a while. By now, most of my contributions to the network are Flutter related, which is why I included it in here. It offers an amazing way to share knowledge with others, which I appreciate a lot. I find (concise) article-esque answers most useful, which is also why some of my answers are very elaborate and could have easily been published as articles. The highest voted answers should be of decent quality, however, the votes do not exactly match how well an answer was written. Thus, I will share highlights going forward (example Twitter post linked).

links.hint: Medium article about SO that might be of interest

projects.title: flutter/plugins & more
projects.description: This is my part to the plugins and packages officially maintained by the Flutter team. That would be flutter/plugins and flutter/packages contributions. Initially, the Firebase plugins for Flutter were also part of flutter/plugins. They were later moved to FirebaseExtended/flutterfire, where I am a frequent contributor. Nevertheless, I have also contributed to other plugins in flutter/plugins :)

projects.title: Flutter framework contributions
projects.description: In terms of the Flutter framework, I mostly committed to flutter/flutter. Furthermore, I have also created some commits in the other Flutter and Dart (dart-lang) repos. However, you can search for these if you really want to :) I only linked to the flutter/flutter commits here and the plugin and packages commits in the other card. Contributions to the other repositories are extremely spread out.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: I think we might have some inception going on here, right? Jokes aside, this portfolio is also a Flutter project of mine and the source code is available on GitHub :) I had some fun with JSON serialization building it because it turns out that this makes maintaining the portfolio a blessing (: In total, this is also a Flutter web demonstration.

links.hint: This portfolio running on Flutter Web
